Body:
BC-BUSINESS-BJT11-COX 
    

      COX NEWS SERVICE THURSDAY BUSINESS BUDGET
      c. 1998 Cox News Service

   These business stories for release Thursday, June 11, 1998, are
moving today to clients of the New York Times News Service.

   Stories are moving in the financial (f) category. Stories also
moving in lifestyle will be marked with (f, l).

   Separate budgets move daily with spot news, features, sports and
commentary.

   All stories have moved, except those with an ETA.

   If you have questions or need a resend, please call CoxNet, the
Cox News Service, at 404-526-5456.

   SUPERCOM _ A panel on wireless services. (Burritt, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution) ETA 8 p.m. ET.

   HOLSENDOLPH-COLUMN _ WebTV was born as an inexpensive way to get
onto the Internet using a black box and a television set. It was
dismissed by many computer veterans as, at best, a training wheels
version of computer surfing -- or worse yet, computing for people
who hate computers. But WebTV has advanced, and so has its fans.
(Holsendolph, Atlanta Journal-Constitution) MOVED.

   AIRPORT-FOOD _ WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. _ Restaurants in Palm Beach
International Airport will have to serve up better prices if they
want to win a contract to sell food. A new request for bids, due
June 18, asks would-be food concessionaires to offer ``street
level'' prices, which are markedly lower than the ``captive
audience'' prices at airports and food courts. (Goldsmith, Palm
Beach Post) MOVED.

   NEIMAN _ PALM BEACH _ The town council Tuesday, June 9, backed
away from barring Neiman Marcus from advertising on television,
radio or in major local newspapers for a year after it opens. ``How
can you impose this condition on this store and not on every other
store on the island?'' asked council President Lesly Smith.
(O'Meilia, Palm Beach Post) MOVED.

   TESTDRIVE _ ATLANTA _ Try as you might, it's really difficult to
couple the usual sport-utility vehicle-associated phrase
``trucklike'' with the new-for-'99 Lexus RX 300 sport-utility. The
words ``luxury car-like'' keep getting in the way. Maybe that's
because of all the leather and real wood that came with the
pearl-painted test RX 300. Then, again, it just may be the
220-horsepower V-6 engine. (DeVault, Atlanta Journal-Constitution)
MOVED.

   NETWATCH _ ATLANTA _ Do not believe everything you read.

   This may seem like obvious advice, but when it comes to the
Internet, it's worth repeating, or maybe scrawling in indelible ink
across the top of your computer monitor. So before you hit the
``forward'' button to send any words of wisdom on to your friends
and co-workers, think about the following Internet ruses. (Katz,
Atlanta Journal-Constitution) MOVED 6/9. (f, l)

   TECHNOBUDDY _ ATLANTA _ Once upon a time, if you wanted to be
techno-cool it was enough to have an e-mail account and a fast
computer. Nowadays that won't get you into the club. So if the real
geeks and gurus edge away from you at work, I am here today to
bring you a message of hope. You, too, can be a geek. (Husted,
Atlanta Journal-Constitution) MOVED.

   THE-MECHANIC _ What refrigerant and retrofit is right for your
car and your bank account? You might want to carefully weigh the
following before you plunk your money down. (Carter, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution) MOVED.

   SHARP-DRIVING _ ATLANTA _ If Lexus is not changing its image, it
is most certainly expanding it to include an entirely new genre of
vehicles. Beginning with the bold styling of its lightning-fast GS
400 sedan and continuing with the debut of the RX 300 sport-utility
vehicle, Lexus is seeking to expand its horizons to a broader and
potentially more youthful customer base. (Sharp, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution) MOVED.

   Story Filed By Cox Newspapers

   For Use By Clients of the New York Times News Service
